item.name: Public Lands, Forests, and Mining Subcommittee

item.title: Desert Tortoise Habitat Conservation Plan Expansion Act, Washington County, Utah

latestAction.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 693.

item.name: Public Lands, Forests, and Mining Subcommittee

item.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Public Lands, Forests, and Mining. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 115-528.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Washington County, Utah, Public Land Act

This bill expands the Desert Tortoise Habitat Conservation Plan to include additional habitat for the desert tortoise in Utah and recognizes a transportation and utility corridor in the Beaver Dam Wash National Conservation Area.

bill.title: Washington County, Utah, Public Land Act

item.title: Washington County, Utah, Public Land Act
A bill to provide for the expansion of the Desert Tortoise Habitat Conservation Plan, Washington County, Utah.
Washington County, Utah, Public Land Act

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Public Lands, Forests, and Mining. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 115-528.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
